commit.title: Zero byte (#147) (emergency fix needed for pelikan)
Clean-up hash functions and introduce MurmurHash3 (#145)
change wheel's sleep timer to make it less flaky (#143)
allow printing negative integers in cc_print (#141)
add metrics to track buf_sock objects (#138)
fixed and re-added cmake install instructions, w/ following notes: include directory made proper relative; opened pattern match b/c include directory should only contain files meant for inclusion.
return NULL when cc_alloc/cc_realloc is called with size == 0
suppress unused parameter warning in debug_log_flush
cc_array - stop doing arithmetic on void *
Update bool member rules in style guide
explicitly make ccommon a C project to avoid checking for CXX related variables
make CHECK_INCLUDES optional; add to include only when present & working
remove install instructions (will re-add later); get rid of cmake warning
reordered pthread dependency to follow check, the earliest dependent lib.
fixed test linkage for ubuntu, tested on 14.04. added support for test-coverage.sh to use xdg-open rather than open when present, ie on ubuntu.
move pipe test to channel; use canonical Thread package var
log signal #; reduce log verbosity in timing wheel
add event_del to test; fix metric bug
refactor epoll implementation, remove del_read/write since there's no immediate use cases for them
fix shadow declaration in tcp unit test
hide struct timeout_event and related functions
remove o_append flag for log rotation
use macros instead of literal for default that's used > once
make all setup use default values if options is NULL; use goto in debug_setup
init metrics before pool creation to avoid losing metric updates
update option print target, bug fix
support floating-point number in option value
hide pool create/destroy methods and invoke them from setup/teardown instead
add option structs to modules that use them
add break to case-switch in metric
add backup to log_reopen, suppress compiler warnings
update log_flush api to return # bytes flushed
adjust some log levels in timing wheel
add metric_describe to give information on metrics' (name, type, description) information
change metric_print to accept customized format
update metric to include description and type information for printing
update with review feedback, add compiler switch example
remove metric_setup/teardown since they do nothing; add doc for metrics
make the necessary change to support musl-gcc
adding dependencies for time related tests by 'make check'
not building test when check is not found
timing wheel tests and bug fixes
tests for time/timer; amend timeout_* to work correctly with negative values on Mac OS X
add timeout event successful allocation check
add debug log timeout event for timing wheel
clean up sock_buf naming and fix boundary check bug
add resource pooling tests; small API refactoring
skip resetting when metrics are NULL
metrics: refactoring 1. temporarily remove maxint type; 2. simplify type and update interface
cc_buf: init metrics and fix typos
add metric_print - will be used in stats implementation
back-porting option related changes and fix some bugs
fix off by one bug in cc_ring_array
Add ring_array push when full test
Add wrap around test for rbuf
remove leading undercore from log_write; fixing other warnings related to signage
rename enum typedef to avoid using _t suffix; remove typedefs that are not very useful
adding macros to values updated directly
Add parenthesis tests to numeric options
Add cc_array test for max expand nelem
Add array test setup, teardown, reset
remove content that's now in Cache Overview
some bug fixes to make build work on centos
ccommon: pelikan - add stats for memcache klog
ccommon: broadbill: update slab setup to automatically setup when profile is not explicitly given
create modules/ and use wildcard to include all future module descriptions
simplify conf.py, minor edit to index
ccommon: Update to work with new ccommon version
ccommon: codec, process refactoring, bug fixes, ctest now works etc
expose digits(), change buffer signage, array refactoring
ccommon: broadbill client: very simple test client
ccommon: fix bugs for large values
ccommon: update log settings with flush interval
ccommon: refactor pipe to use new channel states
Define channel states and use them in tcp_
ccommon: add pipe metrics and update API
use #pragma once to replace include guard macros
update metrics to 1) add initialization 2) regulate naming convention
ccommon: added pipe connection type, remove struct conn until we can come up with a good general interface
Update metrics in a module-local way, add metrics to core modules
updated option to parse integer expressions
reorganize struct event_base to remove epoll/kqueue checks
define sys_signame as linux doesn't have it (bsd does)
adding signal module; fixing option parser
make it cheaper to skip logging by avoid calling _log and using macro
rename a few macros to avoid name clash
fix problems as we rewrite broadbill against ccommon
defensive style: more initialization, no embedded/implicit return
refactor channel and stream interfaces, separating out implementation by file
[Merge][build_cleanup] remove autotools, backed up in autotools_snapshot
change log level of kevent filter
adding client_conn to nio, other minor fixes in nio
adjustment made after trying to build in smfd
[Merge][cmake] add cmake as a compilation option
fixed some issues and now it compiles on linux too
(almost) feature parity between autotool scripts and cmake
adding server_reject and update some OOM messages
[Merge][include] moving headers to /include as a top-level subdir
putting config.h back in as compile time decisions/config options are better provided/documented with the rest of the lib
moving header to topdir, move install top-level Makefile.am
putting all external facing headers in config
use am conditionals to select source for different platforms
clean up code no longer belonging to this repo
make source code g++ compatible (warnings still occur)
augment all headers with conditional extern C to make the lib C++ friendly
making stream skip recv when nbyte is 0
fixing stream related bugs; refactor pending
tracking init status in log; fixing issues
initial check in of stats related files
[Merge][cache-1556] add option module; del code that shouldn't be here
rename some variables in cc_option.[ch], adding print functions
add macro to option; update default values of loggger
removing required filed as we don't seem to need it
update how str is set and check value length
adding option cardinality macro; fix macro used in cc_log.h
remove OPTION_PRINT, we will need something more flexible
remove mbuf_split until we need something like that
adding options to modules whose setup require them
remove time module, this is not generic enough to be here
getting rid of the mem module and data structure (to be added to broadbill later)
adding log level to log message
separate logging config option from assert config option
updating log interface to make it less verbose
verbosity level changes; minor cc_pool changes
lower epoll logging level for incoming events
advancing pointers after read and write
rename some stream data handlers; add mbuf_[l|r]shift()
adding event control options and fix event handling
fixing compiling problems: disabling test & demo for now; fix inclusion, adding print functions; minor fixes
move all binary string related functions in to cc_bstring.[ch]; rest to cc_util.h
fix inclusion order and most of the bugs this surfaced
changed to enum to allow switch, got rid of unnecessary struct setting members
added documentation to cc_settings, added function to print settings descriptions
replace MIN/MAX with those defined in sys/param.h; add Bob Jenkins' lookup3 hash functions
fixed issues, added command line option for config file
adding config.h to include header files
switched over to stailq to save space in header
did a little bit of refactoring
fixed refcount bug and zipmap segfault bug, added zipmap benchmarks
split off print functions into their own file
update string to support byte string; naming updates
finished benchmarking program for normal API functions (still need to do zipmap)
fixed eviction bug where chained item would link to itself causing infinite loop
fixing kqueue compile error; re-enable configure switches
squished incorrect flagging bug resulting in incorrect relinking
did some refactoring, set up item_append to allow for contiguous appends. squished bugs.
added chaining compile time option functionality, squished bugs
added zipmap, did some basic testing
added zipmap, did some basic testing
Changed configure.ac to work on OSX without warnings
initial commit, memory manager supports chaining and slab only eviction.
use a single mbuf as read/write buffer; make connection close decisions on the read path
make sure status is always assigned in the path
change callback return type to void, so there's no side effect within msg I/O; update from previous reviews; notes
update autotool scripts and gitignore file
splitting array_push() to use _array_expand() per Mahak's comment
adding array module; necessary for vectorized read/write over mbuf chain
adding owner field to struct conn
moving linked list entry out of mbuf struct
fix build on Mac OS X
updated mbuf module: fixing bugs, adding comments
initial check in of the mbuf module
fix error: calling the wrong assert function; add comments
adding note file about module design
using nginx style include; typo in README.md
